commenter_a: There are spiritual aspects to female sexuality, this is where belly dancing comes from...before it was a way for women to show their sexual fertility to their husbands it was a practice done by female worshipers of the snake goddess. Not sure but to me this seems like a modern take on that...in most cases such dancing is done for the benefit of men. But when it is done to express one's sexuality in a personal way, it does have an empowering effect. It suggests that a woman's sexuality belongs to her and doesn't need a male audience to be valid.
